boardgame.name: John Company
boardgame.description: Over its 250-year history, the British East India Company grew to become one of the most influential commercial and political organizations in the world. Its profits catapulted the British Empire to global dominance and shaped the fate of some of the world's great nations, but its ascent was anything but easy. The Company was filled with diverging interests and struggled constantly at home and abroad._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;John Company attempts to tell the story of the British East India Company from the inside out. Players will steer their dynasties through the company's history, vying for position, power, and prestige. The goal of the game is simple: Use the Company and the Company's trade to secure your place in society back home. To this end, you guide your scions through their careers, exchanging favors for positions in London or plush colonial posts. Players collectively control the Company, facing tough budgetary decisions and conflicting interests. Should a Governor conduct a campaign to expand company holdings or invest in his region's infrastructure? Perhaps the honest tax revenues would be better diverted to expand his summer estate back home..._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;As the game continues, the Company may face open rebellion in India or outright failure as it grapples with increasingly bold attempts at regulation from the British government. It's even possible that the Company's trade monopoly will be revoked, leaving the players to form and operate their own trading firms. Each game offers a huge range of possibilities, informed chiefly by the decisions the players make. In addition, players can tailor their experience by using one of the three tournament scenarios that cover the Early, Mid, and Late Company that can be played in about 90 minutes. The game also offers a full campaign game that will take players from 1720 to 1857 in an evening._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Taking its inspiration from Phil Eklund's seminal Lords games, John Company offers Greed Incorporated by way of Republic of Rome _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;mdash; and with only sixty cards and multiple scenarios, John Company is one of the most accessible SMG offerings to date._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;mdash;description from the publisher_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

The Good, the Board, and the Cold-Blooded Episode 167 Ethical Challenges in Gameplay
The Good, the Board, and the Great Gambino Episode 157 Geof Gambill_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s Top Ten Games
The Good, the Board, and the King of Chaos: Episode 153 TC_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s Top Ten Games
The Good, the Board, and the Local Yocals : Episode 151 Gaming Conventions

Game: John Company (Sieraa Madre Games) Condition: new in shrinkwrap Language: English This is for a pre-order of the game. Will arrive in November! Thanks in advance for ordering! See below for information on shipping, payment _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; cancellation. Payment: Bank transfer to an EU bank account using IBAN/BIC in advance (normally free of charge if your bank account is nominated in EURO) Paypal (add 3,- Euro to cover the fees. That should be the first choice for non-EU customers.) Pick up the game at my game store (no shipping cost) Shipping: always insured and with tracking Germany: 5,99€ for the first item card games or smaller boxes might be cheaper (please contact me beforehand) EU: 13,99€ up to 2kg 15,99€ up to 5kg 20,99€ up to 10kg Rest of the world: Please contact me before purchasing an item to clarify the shipping costs. I can offer discounts on shipping if multiple marketplace purchases are made. Returns and Cancellation: You may cancel your order without giving any reasons within 14 days after placing your order. Please contact frank@spieleberatung.com and I will attempt to resolve the matter. Unopened copies of the game that are no longer wanted can be returned, but there is a 10% restocking fee payable of the item price and the buyer is responsible for the return shipping costs. Spieleberatung Frank Solnitzky Hainbuchenweg 1 36381 Schlüchtern Germany +49-06661-9115039 frank@spieleberatung.com
New in shrink, from Essen. Shipping is $10 US or $20 international.

When I pre-ordered this, it was in the hopes I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;d be able to play it with my group. Don_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t think I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;m going to be able to get it to the table in the next year and my shelves are full. For shipping purposes, I can either place it in a box 13.5_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;x9.75_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;x3.5_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; weighing total of 2lbs 5oz. Or it will fit in a medium flat-rate box totaling $13.65. Shipping will be from ZIP 47012. **Listing as Like New and I have opened the cards to look through them, even though I did not play a game.

An opportunity to rule 18th century India! The players compete for preferment within the British East India Company (aka John Company) while working to build up the company. Just try not to provoke the Indian Mutiny along the way. The price shown is for UK/EU purchasers (and includes VAT). For purchasers outside the EU, the price is £30.00 (net of UK tax) - note that the purchaser is responsible for paying any duty or tax due on import to their country. I charge shipping at cost, as follows. UK addresses: £2.79 (myHermes, takes 2-3 working days, tracked) Other EU countries: £10.38 (Air mail, takes 1 week or so, not tracked) Europe outside the EU: £8.65 (Air mail, takes 1 week or so, not tracked) Australasia: £14.10 (Air mail, takes 1 week or so, not tracked) USA, Canada _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; elsewhere: £13.35 (Air mail, takes 1 week or so, not tracked)
